snippet.textDisplay: Hey, sorry if I completely missed something, but why wouldn't Aladdin just wish for the law to be changed? There's no rule against the Genie being able to change laws, and if the law was changed so Jasmine could many anybody, then Aladdin could go up to the palace as a suitor, and since Jasmine was already in love with him, she could chose to marry him. No one would worry about royalty having power, because Jasmine could be the true ruler, like how The Queen of England is the true ruler of England despite being married. And you could say that Jasmine might chose another commoner, but we already know that Jasmine loves Aladdin and was slightly put off by other commoners, so she would most likely marry Aladdin. And you could also say that just because he wished for the law to be changed doesn't mean people would follow it, but then Aladdin could wish that the Sultan would change the law, and therefore everyone would have it follow it because it's the sultan after all.

No one would worry about royalty having power, because Jasmine could be the true ruler, like how The Queen of England is the true ruler of England despite being married. And you could say that Jasmine might chose another commoner, but we already know that Jasmine loves Aladdin and was slightly put off by other commoners, so she would most likely marry Aladdin. And you could also say that just because he wished for the law to be changed doesn't mean people would follow it, but then Aladdin could wish that the Sultan would change the law, and therefore everyone would have it follow it because it's the sultan after all.

snippet.textDisplay:
Here's another way to go about it:
1 - Wish for a large extremely loyal army
2 - Wish for immortality (doesn't have to be the age-related one, can just be immune to death besides of old age, so you can't get assassinated)
3 - Wish for Genie to be free so he can't grant wishes again (and especially ones that undo yours)
4 - Use the army to usurp the sultanate
5 - Profit
Sure you use all wishes, but at least it doesn't run the risk of you being assassinated alongside Jasmine if she's the Sultan...
snippet.textOriginal:
Here's another way to go about it:
1 - Wish for a large extremely loyal army
2 - Wish for immortality (doesn't have to be the age-related one, can just be immune to death besides of old age, so you can't get assassinated)
3 - Wish for Genie to be free so he can't grant wishes again (and especially ones that undo yours)
4 - Use the army to usurp the sultanate
5 - Profit
Sure you use all wishes, but at least it doesn't run the risk of you being assassinated alongside Jasmine if she's the Sultan...

snippet.textDisplay: I have a theory that I hope you'll make a video version of it MatPat, could santa be real? Now I know that this isn't a film theory, but there are a lot of santa movies. So it should count. Anyways, my dad told me that santa was based on a real dude named nickolous, and some people called him a saint. He was the nicest guy ever, he gave gifts, and money to charity for kids that can't aford toys, he's the saintiest saint of all saints. He was also a priest. My theory is that when he died God brought him back to life so people that weren't Christians could still celebrate Jesus's birth without knowing it, and that the guys who came up with it actually got it from a dream meeting with him. there's actually evidence that suports this theory. Nick[nickolous] loved giving gifts to kids, so maybe God blessed him so he could do what he loved. Also the guys came up with it AFTER he died! Sure this evidence is circumstantial, but I think we both know it would make a great theory. But hey, that's just a theory... a film theory!

snippet.textDisplay: There had always been female rulers throughout history. There's nothing new or "woke" about it. Females do have the ability to rule, and they have been accepted as rulers. Equality hadn't become an actual issue until modern day. On another note, I liked this theory.
